input_text:
Job Title: Transaction Manager

Location: Austin, Texas Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Company OverviewActive in Texas for more than 19 years, Dosch Marshall Real Estate (DMRE) is the market leader in land brokerage services for multi-family, single-family, and industrial land. Our focus is on representing buyers and sellers for all land uses and committing to providing unmatched representation to our clients. The team at DMRE combines its commercial real estate knowledge, expansive network, and innovative processes to help clients meet and exceed their goals by fighting to find the best buyer at the best price. Our proven track record of successfully guiding clients through the challenges of selling their land and finding their next development site has resulted in Dosch Marshall Real Estate being consistently recognized as a Heavy Hitter in land brokerage by the Business Journal. 
Job DescriptionDMRE is looking for a dynamic, results-oriented individual who has a genuine passion for commercial real estate to join our rapidly expanding team. This role is fast-paced and involves providing continuous support to our brokerage teams and collaborating closely with team members to implement company-wide procedures.
The ideal candidate will possess keen attention to detail, excellent interpersonal skills, and a strong enthusiasm for collaborative work environments. This position is located in our Austin, TX office and will be an integral part of our Operations Team.
Responsibilities
Oversee Transaction Management Processes· Company filing organization· Salesforce processes relating to listings and deals· Company and team specific dashboards and reporting
Manage Deal Tracking and Closing Process· Salesforce data entry for deals from contract pending to under contract to close status · Monitor contract requirements and critical dates· Draft and send commission agreements, listing agreements, and invoices· Conduct commission agreement and listing agreement audits to ensure documents are complete · Send invoice to title company and communicates with escrow agent to ensure smooth and timely process· Serve as additional point of contact for all parties involved in the real estate transaction process· Ensure accuracy of closed deal records in Salesforce· Oversee case study and closing post processes  Oversee Broker Opinion of Value (BOV) Process· Submit BOV requests to marketing· Weekly review and tracking of BOV presentations· Assign internal BOV follow ups accordingly · Assist in creating new marketing collateral for BOVs Listing Agreement Management· Draft listing agreements and sends to landowners · Track status of presented listing agreements· Create new listing file folder and listing object in Salesforce
New Listing Launch Process· If applicable, submit order aerial request and property sign order · Coordinate with broker and landowner to compile due diligence folder to share with potential buyers· Submit Offering Memo (OM) request to marketing then track and review final OM draft· Send OM draft to landowner for approval· Prepare email draft and contact list for initial listing launch email blast
Listing Marketing Process· Coordinate weekly reoccurring schedule for listings, pocket listings, and other miscellaneous email blasts· Utilize MailChimp and Salesforce features to send email blasts · Create new contact reports for each email blast based upon previous feedback· Log and track buyer feedback internally · Create property status reports to share with clients· Field listing call inquiries, send property info, and facilitate discussions with potential buyers· Present offers to clients and assist with redlining offers if necessary· Help run Best and Final and/or Call for Offers processes· Create offer matrix and offer package to present to client · Manage listing statuses on marketing websites including Crexi and Co Star/ LoopNet
Organize and Maintain Contact Database and Distribution Lists· Track, enter, and update company and contact records on daily basis· Ensures contact’s primary product type, regional preferences, and emailcommunication preferences are up to date



Preferred Qualifications· Bachelor’s degree from accredited university in business or related field· Strong written and verbal communication skills · Excellent time management skills · A minimum of 1-year work experience in Commercial Real Estate · Familiar with commercial real estate operations· CRE License preferred· Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, Google Suite, CoStar, Crexi, and Salesforce 
Benefits· Starting Salary: negotiable; based on experience.· Comprehensive medical and wellness benefits available.· Paid time off for personal use and holidays.· Retirement plan including 401(k) and company matching.
Hours and Schedule· Full-time employee; minimum 40-hour work week.· Standard business hours; Monday through Friday.
Work Location: Austin, TX
If interested in applying for the position, please send cover letter and resume to Tripp Rich at tripp.rich@dmre.com

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Transaction Manager
output_json.summary: Join Dosch Marshall Real Estate's rapidly expanding team as a Transaction Manager in Austin, TX.
job_responsibilities: Manage Deal Tracking and Closing Process
Organize and Maintain Contact Database and Distribution Lists
benefits: Negotiable starting salary based on experience
Paid time off for personal use and holidays
Retirement plan including 401(k) and company matching
